I have bought this sound card mainly because of the dedicated headphone out and the thx certification, I own a gigabyte motherboard with a loseless audio 7.1 onboard card so I have compared it to this card and have realized that the onboard sound is OK but this sound card offers more warm deeper broader sound than the onboard sound for music.pros.1-scout mode, immpressive feature gives you the advantage of being able to hear footsteps and other small sounds and pin point the exact location of the sound even on stereo headphone.2- dedicated headphone out and a build in amblifier, I have a 5.1 speaker setup and a studio grade denon headphones, I live in acrowded house, so when everyone goes to sleep at night I can simply switch to my headphones with no trouble and no connect disconnect dilema, just make the switch from creative software.3- I wasn`t going to spend more than 100 dollars on a sound card, and I wasn`t going to sacrifice the connectivity ( 5.1 out, dedicated headphone out and a digital out and in) so this was the perfect match for my needs and a future resistance since you can connect almost any speaker setup to it later on, besides its relatively new.4- THX certified and THX truestudio, this card is an all around suited for movies music and games, if you own power dvd 11 or similar software with a feature like THX theatre or THX studio, this card will bring you the intended sound quality of this feature and you can hear the difference.5- dolby decoder for digital out.6- amazing sound quality when gaming, weapon firing sounds more realistic, surround sound even on stereo headphones, you get really immersed in the action.7- quad core could take lots of work off your cpu resulting in a better overall performance of your computer, since this chip does everything when it comes to audio.cons.1- 6000omh can be sort of an issue for low omh headphones, since on high volume you could accidently damage your headphones, your max volume on normal headphones would usually be 20%.2- window 7 only supported.notes-make sure you install latest driver and software edition from creative website and update the driver from windows device manager, there is an update 20/2/2012 version( this version has a better surround sound effect which feels more natural and crispy) so you can get the optimum sound quality.-this card is not an audiophile sound card but is a major improvment over onboard 5.1 and 7.1 intergated sound since I have compared it to my dolby home theatre gigabyte 990fx which has a 7.1 108noise ration and it felt kind of muddy in games and sll sound seem to come from a single direction or something or from right or left only, this card is more like a mix between a gaming card and an entertainment sound card although you will feel the real thrill when gaming!, for those who are looking for a dedicated headphone jack with amps and not willing to sacrafice the 5.1 system this would suit you will, since most cards in the market are either hi fi headphone /2.1 or 5.1 output.

I find that I use mine daily, but only primarily use it to shut down my computer and scroll through webpages.I give it 5 stars as a techie that likes that Windows is pushing the envelope with speed and the new touch interface, and truly believe that after you get used to it, there's little to miss from Windows 7.
You can finally log in straight to the desktop, which is nice, but even on the "Pro" version you still have to actually set it.
Not an upgrade.

Furthermore, the research and design engineers responsible for this ridiculous product has deprived the consumer of the ability to select the Classic Menu which is more useful.Then, there is the inability to place shortcuts of useful applications on your desktop.Further to this, there is a compatibility issue with most software due to the fact that most drivers have either not yet been released by software manufacturers or, resultant of the instability of this Operating System which is full of bugs, have decided not to released drivers for this version, given the fact that an avalanche of complaints from users has driven this Operating System out of the market, and forced Microsoft to release Windows 9 within one year of its release.Then, documents created on Windows 7 are all automatically converted to read only files that does not allow users to edit the document even though you log in as the administrator, due to a compatibility issue.Furthermore, the Operating System prevents users from saving documents into a designated location and forces you to save it under the documents folder.Further to this, the designated location for webshot playlist has been changed, and despite replicating the playlist in every conceivable location, certain folders still fails to materialize on the webshot playlist; probably resultant of a compatibility issue with Operating System 8.1.Then, there is the issue of a constant inability to establish a connection with smartphones connected through a USB port, as well as the connectivity issues that renders your keyboard non-functional.Apart from this, there is a connectivity issue that causes wifi signals to drop, necessitating the user to needlessly reconnect to the internet, coupled with the fact that Internet Explorer constantly encounters a problem in connecting with the server.Further to this, Windows Operating System 8.1 prevents users from attaching files and documents on yahoo or google mail, nor does it allow yahoo or google mail to automatically save contacts to whom you have send e-mails into your contacts list.Lastly, the back-up function necessitates that you relocate all your files to the Desktop because there is no available option for you to select the drive which you intend to back-up, while not complying with your scheduled back-up frequency, coupled with the fact that the back-up function doesn't fully back-up all the files and needlessly creates duplicate and triplicate files.This is the most infuriating Operating System to live with and someone should shoot Bill Gates with a gun.

This thing is truly amazing and I really don't understand the negative reviews on it.I bought a few different diffusers last year and they were all a waste of money,cheaply made,and didn't work at all or improve my photos.I will admit that I am an amateur with my T3i and should've learned more about photography instead of depending on devices and spending extra money.I mainly do indoor shooting with my 18-55mm lens and if you do the same then you know that all of your pictures are usually washed out,to bright,or shadowy from the on camera flash.If I got a few really great pictures with the on camera flash it was usually luck and most of the pictures looked completely different from each other,especially if I moved.I hated how my daytime pictures would look like it was taken at night or the background behind the subject would be to dark or black.The on camera flash also made the pictures look cheap and made the subjects look older,different or flawed.I personally don't have the money to spend $250-$400 on a new Canon flash so I figured I was screwed until I found this lightscoop literally 2 weeks ago.I did some research on it,saw some picture examples which I didn't know were real or fake ads but figured what is $20 if it actually works.I received it last week and did some test shoots and was instantly awed at the new photos which were literally 10 times better,clearer and evenly lit.I bought the standard version and some people say that the lightscoop is cheaply made and it kinda is but I have dropped it 3 times already and it is perfectly fine with no scratches or anything wrong with it.It feels rather sturdy imo.Not only does this thing work perfectly for indoor use,it also improves the actual quality of the images and is very easy to put on/take off and use as well.It was a Night and Day difference using the lightscoop and I didn't even have to add lighting,adjust my set up or change up many settings on my camera to get the perfect look that I was going for.You really just have to bump up to a higher iso.My pictures of just simple stuff inside of my house went from looking like a point and shoot camera to professional images which I never would've expected in a million years from a $20 device,since most of them are gimmicks.I didn't know simply bouncing light/the flash was so necessary with pictures until I used the lightscoop.This is without a doubt a life/money saver for those who shoot indoors or just simple family pictures and don't want or need a professional flash.Trust me,you will not be disappointed and I know I will be using this for many years.Make sure that the lightscoop is first compatible with your DSLR/Camera before buying it.Remember to bump up to a higher iso while using this because your pictures will be very dark if you don't.I personally use iso 800 on my Canon T3i while using this inside my house.

Well I see some bad reviews for this item but I took my chances because the price for each gigabyte in each disc is USD$0,03 is less than a half the price of a cheap Internal hard drive, so this is a no brainier.I bought two packs along with my new burner:Samsung SE-506AB/TSBD 6X USB2.0 External Slim Blu-ray Writer Drive (Black), I have less than a day with both, a total of 18 discs burned so far, all of them are Ok, all looks fine on Nero SpeedDisc tool, both lines on the graph are growing smoothly so the discs are well burned.This discs works at 4x I'm working with Nero and they allow to burn a maximum of 23,3 GB, so this is really great.I realized that is a lot cheaper and safe for me, store my information inside Blu ray discs than in Hard drives, I have two accidents with my hard drives this year and the loss of information was huge for me, so I feel safer with my data in an optical disc.These discs identify themselves as "Phillps" inside the Nero DiscSpeed, is just curious for me, they are working great for now, I will write again if something wrong happens with the time.Well by the time I wrote this paragraph, I have burned 50 discs, the results where 48 in good shape and 2 damaged, both of them come soon in the stack something like the 10th disc and here are my conclusions:1) Burn this discs at 2X, while they can be burned at 4X, after checking my first discs at 4X I noticed by using Nero SpeedDisc, that the graph shown is not smooth, have some pecks and that is not good, points that the burner made an effort, the information was ok but the results by the tool was enough for me to take a little bit more of time and burn them at 2X2) Leave the hard drive where the burning information is, quiet, I mean my coaster comes because I start to move files to build the next disc, since we are talking of building a 25Gb disc the amount of information being moved is huge, so while I do that the buffer in Nero Burning Room, drains and I got my bad disc, but was my fault, now I build the next disc while I verify the information written on the current disc so there is no problem, but when the burning process start, I go to see TV or something to avoid the temptation of use the hard drive.So after 50 discs burned, just 2 fail and where because I play with the hard drive while it was burning, so this discs are great for the price, they are the first BD-R that I have on my hands and I'm happy with the results, definitely I will get more of this when I need more BD-R.
